data.text: @anymanfitness Im still curious how I haven’t had it lol.
@anymanfitness @RobertSimmons 2. Don’t think it was a conspiracy at all. Folks that follow data probably assumed more than 140 to be honest.  Shocked it’s that low.

@anymanfitness @RobertSimmons 1. Pretty sure they have assumed that there were far more cases all along.  Linkis from November, and they estimated 1 in 4 cases were being tracked. Then factor in at home rapids in the Omicron wave that weren’t reported. I’m shocked it’s “only” 140MM.  https://t.co/i9qiuG70Qj
@anymanfitness Partially agree but it isn’t like they’ve hidden the numbers. https://t.co/eOoQvW2wLE.

@RobertSimmons My issue is they didn't just become aware of this today and release it. They've known for months on end, and yet they still kept it going for no reason. Specifically the kids, who were the last to be "freed".
@anymanfitness Not defending every policy taken over last 2 years, but trying to be realistic

@anymanfitness My point is the tests are imperfect but good indicators of trends, and people including CDC have been using them and other data to estimate the true numbers all along. Some people are at high risk of serious illness, everyone can be a carrier including kids
